Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Circulating Tumor Cell Prognostic Utility in Stage IV Resected Melanoma Patients

Trial_Design.evidence: Conducted as a prospective international phase III randomised controlled trial

Participants.evidence: Eligibility criteria included resected stage IV melanoma

Intervention.evidence: Participants were randomised to receive adjuvant therapy with a whole-cell melanoma vaccine plus Bacille Calmette-Guerin (BCG) or placebo plus BCG

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to assess the prognostic utility of circulating tumor cells (CTCs) in stage IV resected melanoma patients

Method_Outcome.evidence: Pretreatment CTC status was significantly associated with disease-free survival (DFS) (HR 1.64, p=0.002) and overall survival (OS) (HR 1.53, p=0.028)

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was performed using a computer-generated sequence, with allocation concealment

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was applied to outcome assessors

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 244 patients were randomised, with 122 in each group

Result_Outcome.evidence: Pretreatment CTC status was significantly associated with disease-free survival (DFS) (HR 1.64, p=0.002) and overall survival (OS) (HR 1.53, p=0.028)

Harms.evidence: No significant adverse events were reported
